text: I have the privilege of presenting this
year's faculty Awards teaching at
Harvard Business School is challenging
for a number of reasons first you have
to teach HBS students all of whom have
strong opinions and all of whom are
never wrong
ever the essence of the case method
means that you have no control over
student comments and no telling where a
discussion may lead Beyond this you have
to respectfully ignore the classroom
statues of Liberty who constantly have
their hands up and you know who you are
while also drawing out comments from
those students who are always asleep
hung over or
both you must pretend to hear those
students who whisper their comments
while also appearing like you are
listening to those comments that just go
on and on and on and on and on your job
is truly difficult and we admire your
dedication to the art of teaching here
at
HBS each member of the class of 2010 was
given the opportunity to vote for their
favorite firste professor and their
favorite seconde Professor based on
inspiration knowledge transfer
accessibility career guidance and
feedback while HBS polls typically yield
a less than 5% response rate over 700
members of the HBS class of 2010 voted
for the faculty Awards a testament to
the impact our professors have on us
here at HBS
the votes were tallied and adjusted for
the total number of students each
Professor taught today we recognize two
firste professors and three second-year
professors who the class of 2010 have
voted to be recognized with this year's
faculty
awards first I would like to invite
Professor Tom Nicholas to come
forward Professor Nicholas taught the
entrepreneurial manager to section J
[Applause]
his students describe him as teaching
with an unmatched level of energy and
enthusiasm one student describing that
he literally runs through the classroom
during case
discussions students also recognize
Professor Nicholas's personal attention
to his students keeping his office door
open for intellectual discussions while
also offering personal advice in saying
goodbye to the section
he prepared a speech with funny
anecdotes and memories of everybody in
the class and one student comments that
I couldn't have asked for a more
supportive and downto Earth faculty
member to work with congratulations
Professor
[Applause]
Nicholas so our next award goes to
Professor Tom Piper who taught financial
reporting and control our accounting
course to section
[Applause]
F so section F describes Professor Piper
as teaching moral courage first empathy
second and accounting third he started
each day prepared not only to impart
knowledge but also to listen and he
demonstrated a z for a zest for life
that was
infectious many of his students describe
Professor Piper as a role model and as
the rare individual who both taught us
about business and motivated us to be
better people Professor Piper is
described as being synonymous with all
that is special about HBS and one
student writes that I will be forever
grateful that I had the honor of being
one of his students congratulations
Professor Piper
[Applause]
I'd like to invite Professor Clayton
Christensen to come
[Applause]
forward Professor Christensen taught the
second year class building and
sustaining a successful
Enterprise Professor Christensen is
described as possessing a special mix of
intellectual curiosity in the classroom
with an incredibly genuine concern and
interest for all of his students one of
his students comments that Professor
Christensen changed the way that I think
not only about business strategy and
organizations but about life purpose
family and learning he showed he shared
personal news with his students with
such honesty and vulnerability that it
was clear how sacred he viewed our
classroom to be and how much like a
family our class had become his students
also note that in the final class
session
Professor Christensen shared with us
what it means to lead a devoted
purposeful Inspired Life with one
student remarking that the stories he
told and the lessons he imparted will
always be with
me personally I met Professor
Christensen for the first time when I
went to notify him of this award and
that five-minute interaction was one of
the highlights of my HBS experience
congratulations Professor Christensen
and thank you for being such a blessing
to the HBS community
[Applause]
our next faculty award goes to Professor
David Moss who taught the seconde class
creating the modern Financial system
Professor Moss is described as the
humblest Superstar Professor who
combines a Mastery of his field with a
humility to listen to others and a
passion for the topic he
teaches he distills even the most
complex topics into their Essential
Elements and is able to decipher what a
student is trying to say and interpret
it for the rest of the
class one student remarks that a comment
could be incoherent it could be in a
madeup language but immediately
Professor Moss would locate the golden
kernel of Truth in it and say it back to
the class with a fluency that made it
shine and made the student proud
thinking yeah that's what I
meant above it all his students describe
him as a wonderfully humble and
approachable person who has a knowledge
of the financial crisis that is supreme
and an ability to teach that is
unparalleled congratulations Professor
Moss so our final faculty award goes to
Professor zanet ton who taught the
second year class coordinating and
managing Supply chains
[Applause]
her students say that they will always
remember her sheer energy and passion in
the classroom one student comments that
to be honest Supply change is a pretty
dry subject but I was never bored in
class as Professor ton brought cases to
life and deeply engaged students with
anecdotes from the field she ensured her
students gained perspective on how
supply chain foot soldiers viewed their
Liv lives and jobs and even organized
two service trips to the food bank
getting 150 HBS students off campus to
do a community service project together
Professor ton is described as being an
incredibly warm and caring teacher a
real role model and someone passionate
about her work and passionate about
working with others one student shares
she set a high standard for us in the
classroom and Beyond congratulations
Professor Tom
so please join me in not only
congratulating this year's faculty Award
winners but all of the dedicated and
inspiring professors who have truly
enriched our time here at Harvard
Business School
[Applause]
[Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
